data.enText: to build or place sth in a particular position
to consider how an idea, event, etc. is related to other things that influence your view of it

data.chText: 我尽量把这些事件与其历史背景联系起来。
data.enText: Let me try and situate the events in their historical context.

example: She posited her hand on his shoulder
deposit the suitcase on the bench
fix your eyes on this spot

tr: determine or indicate the place, site, or limits of, as if by an instrument or by a survey
example: Our sense of sight enables us to locate objects in space
Locate the boundaries of the property

value.def: If you situate something such as an idea or fact in a particular context, you relate it to that context, especially in order to understand it better.

example.ex: How do we situate Christianity in the context of modern physics and psychology?
example.tran: 我们怎样把基督教放在现代物理学和心理学的背景下来考虑呢？

value.tran: (尤指为了更好地理解某事)把…放在(特殊的环境中)，把…跟(具体情境)联系
